Graduate School Applicant Database Analysis
  • API Reference

API Reference

This section provides detailed API documentation for all modules in the system.

Web Application

Flask application for displaying applicant database analytics.

app.is_busy()[source]

Check if the system is currently busy with an operation.

app.busy_state()[source]

Context manager to set/unset busy state.

app.index()[source]

Main page displaying all query results.

app.pull_data()[source]

Scrape new data from GradCafe and add it to the database. Returns JSON with status and message.

app.update_analysis()[source]

Update LLM-generated analysis for applicants in the database. Returns JSON with status and message.

Key Routes:

app.index()[source]

Main dashboard route that displays all query results.

Returns:

Rendered HTML template with query results

Return type:

str

app.pull_data()[source]

Scrape new data from GradCafe and insert into database.

Workflow:

  1. Check if system is busy

  2. Run scraper subprocess

  3. Load scraped JSON data

  4. Parse and insert records into database

  5. Return status and counts

Returns:

JSON response with status, inserted count, and skipped count

Return type:

flask.Response

Status:

200 OK on success

Status:

409 Conflict if busy

Status:

500 Internal Server Error on failure

Response Format:

{
  "status": "success",
  "message": "Successfully added 42 new entries to database",
  "inserted": 42,
  "skipped": 8,
  "timestamp": "2026-02-09T15:30:45.123456"
}
app.update_analysis()[source]

Update LLM-generated analysis fields for applicants.

Returns:

JSON response with status and message

Return type:

flask.Response

Status:

200 OK on success

Status:

409 Conflict if busy

Status:

500 Internal Server Error on failure

Data Scraping

This script fetches applicant posts from The Grad Cafe. It extracts relevant fields from each post and saves the data in JSON format.

scrape.scrape_data(base_url: str = 'https://www.thegradcafe.com/', limit: int = 50) → List[Dict[str, str | None]][source]

Fetch entries by iterating through paginated survey pages (?page=1, ?page=2, etc.).

scrape.save_data(data: List[Dict[str, str | None]], output_path: str = 'applicant_data.json') → None[source]

Save data (list of dicts) to JSON file.

Main Functions:

scrape.scrape_data(base_url: str = 'https://www.thegradcafe.com/', limit: int = 50) → List[Dict[str, str | None]][source]

Fetch entries by iterating through paginated survey pages (?page=1, ?page=2, etc.).

Scrape graduate school application data from GradCafe.

Parameters:

  • limit (int) – Maximum number of entries to scrape

  • page_offset (int) – Starting page number (default: 1)

  • user_agent (str) – User agent string for HTTP requests

  • search_url (str) – Base URL for GradCafe search

Returns:

List of entry dictionaries

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

Entry Format:

{
    "url": str,
    "university": str,
    "program_name": str,
    "comments": Optional[str],
    "date_posted": str,
    "applicant_status": str,  # "Accepted", "Rejected", "Waitlist"
    "start_term": str,  # "Fall 2026", "Spring 2026", etc.
    "citizenship": str,  # "International", "American"
    "gpa": Optional[str],
    "gre_score": Optional[str],
    "gre_v": Optional[str],
    "gre_aw": Optional[str],
    "degree": str  # "PhD", "Masters", "Other"
}
scrape.save_data(data: List[Dict[str, str | None]], output_path: str = 'applicant_data.json') → None[source]

Save data (list of dicts) to JSON file.

Save scraped data to JSON file.

Parameters:

  • data (List[Dict]) – List of entry dictionaries

  • path (str) – Output file path

Return type:

None

Data Cleaning

Utilities for loading, cleaning, and saving GradCafe application data.

clean.load_data(path: str) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Load application data from a JSON file.

clean.clean_data(data: Iterable[Dict[str, Any]], missing_value: str | None = None) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Convert data into a structured, cleaned format.

  • Strips HTML from all string fields.

  • Normalizes missing/empty values to a consistent format (default: None).

clean.save_data(data: List[Dict[str, Any]], path: str) → None[source]

Save cleaned data into a JSON file.

Main Functions:

clean.load_data(path: str) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Load application data from a JSON file.

Load application data from a JSON file.

Parameters:

path (str) – Path to JSON file

Returns:

List of records

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

Raises:

ValueError – If data is not a list

clean.clean_data(data: Iterable[Dict[str, Any]], missing_value: str | None = None) → List[Dict[str, Any]][source]

Convert data into a structured, cleaned format.

  • Strips HTML from all string fields.

  • Normalizes missing/empty values to a consistent format (default: None).

Convert data into a structured, cleaned format.

  • Strips HTML from all string fields

  • Normalizes missing/empty values to a consistent format

Parameters:

  • data (Iterable[Dict]) – Raw data records

  • missing_value (Optional[str]) – Value to use for missing data (default: None)

Returns:

List of cleaned records

Return type:

List[Dict[str, Any]]

clean.save_data(data: List[Dict[str, Any]], path: str) → None[source]

Save cleaned data into a JSON file.

Save cleaned data into a JSON file.

Parameters:

  • data (List[Dict]) – Cleaned data records

  • path (str) – Output file path

Return type:

None

Data Loading

load_data.parse_gpa(gpa_str)[source]

Extract numeric GPA value from string like ‘GPA 3.89’.

load_data.parse_gre_score(gre_str)[source]

Extract numeric GRE score from strings like: - ‘GRE 327’ (total) - ‘GRE V 157’ (verbal) - ‘GRE AW 3.50’ (analytical writing)

load_data.parse_date(date_str)[source]

Parse date string like ‘January 31, 2026’ to date object. Returns None if parsing fails.

load_data.extract_p_id_from_url(url)[source]

Extract the ID from the GradCafe URL.

load_data.clean_string(s)[source]

Remove NUL characters and other problematic characters from strings.

load_data.create_applicants_table(conn)[source]

Create the applicants table if it doesn’t exist.

load_data.load_json_data(json_file_path, conn)[source]

Load data from JSON Lines file into the applicants table.

load_data.verify_data(conn)[source]

Verify the loaded data by showing some statistics.

load_data.main()[source]

Main function to create table and load data.

Uses DATABASE_URL environment variable if set (format: postgresql://user:password@host:port/database) Otherwise uses individual environment variables or defaults: - DB_HOST (default: localhost) - DB_PORT (default: 5432) - DB_NAME (default: bradleyballinger) - DB_USER (default: bradleyballinger) - DB_PASSWORD (default: empty)

Parsing Functions:

load_data.parse_gpa(gpa_str)[source]

Extract numeric GPA value from string like ‘GPA 3.89’.

Extract numeric GPA value from string like ‘GPA 3.89’.

Parameters:

gpa_str (Optional[str]) – GPA string to parse

Returns:

Numeric GPA value or None

Return type:

Optional[float]

Examples:

>>> parse_gpa('GPA 3.89')
3.89
>>> parse_gpa('3.75')
3.75
>>> parse_gpa(None)
None
load_data.parse_gre_score(gre_str)[source]

Extract numeric GRE score from strings like: - ‘GRE 327’ (total) - ‘GRE V 157’ (verbal) - ‘GRE AW 3.50’ (analytical writing)

Extract numeric GRE score from strings like ‘GRE 327’, ‘GRE V 157’.

Parameters:

gre_str (Optional[str]) – GRE score string to parse

Returns:

Numeric score or None

Return type:

Optional[float]

load_data.parse_date(date_str)[source]

Parse date string like ‘January 31, 2026’ to date object. Returns None if parsing fails.

Parse date string like ‘January 31, 2026’ to date object.

Parameters:

date_str (Optional[str]) – Date string to parse

Returns:

Date object or None if parsing fails

Return type:

Optional[datetime.date]

load_data.extract_p_id_from_url(url)[source]

Extract the ID from the GradCafe URL.

Extract the ID from the GradCafe URL.

Parameters:

url (Optional[str]) – GradCafe URL

Returns:

Extracted p_id or None

Return type:

Optional[int]

Example:

>>> extract_p_id_from_url('https://www.thegradcafe.com/survey/result/12345')
12345
load_data.clean_string(s)[source]

Remove NUL characters and other problematic characters from strings.

Remove NUL characters from string.

Parameters:

s (Optional[str]) – String to clean

Returns:

Cleaned string or None

Return type:

Optional[str]

Database Functions:

load_data.create_applicants_table(conn)[source]

Create the applicants table if it doesn’t exist.

Create the applicants table in the database.

Parameters:

conn (connection) – PostgreSQL connection object

Return type:

None

load_data.load_json_data(json_file_path, conn)[source]

Load data from JSON Lines file into the applicants table.

Load JSON data from file and insert into database.

Reads JSON lines format, parses each record, and performs batch insertion with automatic duplicate handling via ON CONFLICT.

Parameters:

  • json_file_path (str) – Path to JSON lines file

  • conn (connection) – PostgreSQL connection object

Returns:

Total number of records inserted

Return type:

int

load_data.verify_data(conn)[source]

Verify the loaded data by showing some statistics.

Display statistics about the loaded data.

Parameters:

conn (connection) – PostgreSQL connection object

Return type:

None

load_data.main()[source]

Main function to create table and load data.

Uses DATABASE_URL environment variable if set (format: postgresql://user:password@host:port/database) Otherwise uses individual environment variables or defaults: - DB_HOST (default: localhost) - DB_PORT (default: 5432) - DB_NAME (default: bradleyballinger) - DB_USER (default: bradleyballinger) - DB_PASSWORD (default: empty)

Main function to create table and load data.

Connects to database, creates table if needed, loads data from llm_extend_applicant_data.json, and displays verification statistics.

Return type:

None

Database Queries

query_data.get_connection()[source]

Create and return a database connection.

Uses DATABASE_URL environment variable if set (format: postgresql://user:password@host:port/database) Otherwise uses individual environment variables or defaults: - DB_HOST (default: localhost) - DB_PORT (default: 5432) - DB_NAME (default: bradleyballinger) - DB_USER (default: bradleyballinger) - DB_PASSWORD (default: empty)

query_data.question_1(conn)[source]

How many entries do you have in your database who have applied for Fall 2026?

query_data.question_2(conn)[source]

What percentage of entries are from international students (not American or Other)?

query_data.question_3(conn)[source]

What is the average GPA, GRE, GRE V, GRE AW of applicants who provide these metrics?

What is the average GPA of American students in Fall 2026?

What percent of entries for Fall 2026 are Acceptances?

query_data.question_6(conn)[source]

What is the average GPA of applicants who applied for Fall 2026 who are Acceptances?

query_data.question_7(conn)[source]

How many entries are from applicants who applied to JHU for a masters degree in Computer Science?

query_data.question_8(conn)[source]

How many entries from 2026 are acceptances from Georgetown, MIT, Stanford, CMU for PhD CS?

Do numbers for question 8 change if you use LLM Generated Fields?

What are the top 10 most applied-to programs for Fall 2026?

How do acceptance rates compare between PhD and Masters programs?

query_data.main()[source]

Run all queries and display results.

Connection Management:

query_data.get_connection()[source]

Create and return a database connection.

Uses DATABASE_URL environment variable if set (format: postgresql://user:password@host:port/database) Otherwise uses individual environment variables or defaults: - DB_HOST (default: localhost) - DB_PORT (default: 5432) - DB_NAME (default: bradleyballinger) - DB_USER (default: bradleyballinger) - DB_PASSWORD (default: empty)

Create and return a database connection.

Uses DATABASE_URL environment variable if set, otherwise uses individual DB_* environment variables or defaults.

Returns:

PostgreSQL connection object

Return type:

psycopg.connection

    ...
]
query_data.main()[source]

Run all queries and display results.

Main function to run all queries.

Connects to database, executes all 11 queries, prints results, and closes connection.

Return type:

None

Data Types

Common data types used throughout the API:

Entry Dictionary:

Entry = TypedDict('Entry', {
    'url': str,
    'university': str,
    'program_name': str,
    'comments': Optional[str],
    'date_posted': str,
    'applicant_status': str,
    'start_term': str,
    'citizenship': str,
    'gpa': Optional[str],
    'gre_score': Optional[str],
    'gre_v': Optional[str],
    'gre_aw': Optional[str],
    'degree': str,
    'llm_generated_program': Optional[str],
    'llm_generated_university': Optional[str]
})

Database Record:

Record = Tuple[
    int,    # p_id
    str,    # program
    str,    # comments
    date,   # date_added
    str,    # url
    str,    # status
    str,    # term
    str,    # us_or_international
    float,  # gpa
    float,  # gre
    float,  # gre_v
    float,  # gre_aw
    str,    # degree
    str,    # llm_generated_program
    str     # llm_generated_university
]

Error Handling

All modules implement consistent error handling:

Common Exceptions:

  • FileNotFoundError - Data file not found

  • json.JSONDecodeError - Invalid JSON format

  • psycopg.Error - Database connection or query errors

  • ValueError - Invalid data format

  • RuntimeError - System busy (concurrent operations)

Error Response Format:

{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Description of what went wrong",
    "timestamp": "2026-02-09T15:30:45.123456"
}
